What degrees can I pursue?
Give me details on the courses offered
Information about academic programs
Tell me what I can study at Centennial
Courses and programs overview
responses: Centennial College offers almost 200 full-time and about 150 part-time programs in various fields including business, communications, community and health studies, general arts, English language studies, engineering technology, hospitality, tourism, and transportation.

patterns: When is the application deadline?

Last date to apply?
What's the cutoff for applications?

Deadline to apply for admission?
Application cutoff date?
When's the last chance to apply?
responses: You should apply as soon as possible once you know that Centennial College is an option for you. While there is no deadline for applications, many programs fill up months before their start time, so apply early for your best chances of admission.

Process for applying?
What's involved in applying?
Application submission process?
Walk me through applying
responses: For full-time programs (except apprenticeships), please apply online at www.ontariocolleges.ca. For part-time programs, please register by phone, fax, or online.

responses: Once our Admissions Department receives your application, you will receive an acknowledgment letter and further instructions if needed. Successful candidates will receive an offer of admission along with a fee statement.
